Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ran Yang "karen"
Reviews.Content: I returned the pentax and got this one. 20 dollars more expensive but I like it. so far so good.

Reviews.Title: great super-entry level camera for young kids
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: do not expect much quality photos with such a tiny lens. however the size and ease of use made photography available also for my little 5 yrs old daughter. Not mentioning the pink color...Now, when becoming 6+, she wants to use her dad's camera...As mentioned - photo quality is mediocre (I clean the lens regularly), but all the other features are very nice ("especially the red hut symbol when focus achieve" per my daughter.

Reviews.Title: Be Forewarned!
Reviews.Author: Kathe Beauvais
Reviews.Content: Be careful with this camera. I had one and dropped it for the first time and it broke! After searching online for what to do or to see if this had happened to others I found out it had happened to many other owners and I would have to get it repaired.It was to cost $70 to repair so I am just going to buy a new one!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier for the price
Reviews.Author: MomNMore
Reviews.Content: This little camera is a wonderful value for well under $100.  It seems digital cameras are somewhat disposable these days... breathe on it wrong, it's broken. So after going through a few moderately priced digitals I decided on a cheap one that could be replaced without breaking the bank. This camera has great features that are easy to use - burst shooting, short videos, etc. and it has a long battery life as well.  It is small enough to stick in a pocket and take anywhere, and the lens cover slides down to turn the camera on. I bought two more versions of this camera for both daughters and both are equally happy with theirs.  I highly recommend this for everyday photos and quick point-and-shoot, which is what you need with growing, fast-moving little ones in the house.

Reviews.Title: Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a christmas present.  Arrived on time.  Sister loved the color. Very happy with ease of use. loved compactability.

Reviews.Title: Good tiny camera
Reviews.Author: aaron leow
Reviews.Content: i had a lumix fs15 before, and i was pretty impressed by it...paid much more for that model like a year and a half ago...this one had pretty much the same specifications, except that it has HD video, new Venus IV engine and supports SDXC memory cards, which is good....but it doesn't have the leica lens like the old model and also it does not allow AF Tracking function...but it's still a good buy at 80 usd.

Reviews.Title: Error from start
Reviews.Author: G. Brewster
Reviews.Content: I have another Panasonic Lumix, but it is a larger camera, I believe the hybrid model.  I wanted something small for vacation.  Upon opening, it never worked.  Charged, but had a lens error, which was funny because I bought this kind hoping to avoid that in the future.  I returned for a refund right away.  Side note ~ I ended up buying an 8 zoom Kodak Easyshare and it lasted not even a month before errors.  Very frustrating to find a pocket sized camera that doesn't break quickly.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: UncleRed
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves the size and the color of this camera. I haven't had much time to play with it so I can't really give a review at this time
